abstract: NBC’s latest edition of “The Biggest Loser” — this time, featuring dieting couples who will be judged by their combined weight loss — got off to a solid start in the ratings on Tuesday, as 10.4 million viewers tuned in from 8 p.m. to 10 p.m. for the show’s debut, according to Nielsen’s overnight estimates. Among adults 18 to 49, the episode fared better than any of the four previous premieres of the series, boosting NBC to a second-place finish for the night.
lead_paragraph: NBC’s latest edition of “The Biggest Loser” — this time, featuring dieting couples who will be judged by their combined weight loss — got off to a solid start in the ratings on Tuesday, as 10.4 million viewers tuned in from 8 p.m. to 10 p.m. for the show’s debut, according to Nielsen’s overnight estimates. Among adults 18 to 49, the episode fared better than any of the four previous premieres of the series, boosting NBC to a second-place finish for the night.
